6 Linux and UNIX platforms

6.5 The MLWorks runtime

The UNIX MLWorks runtime uses X Window System libraries and Motif libraries. On Solaris both statically and dynamically linked versions of the runtime are available. On Irix, only a dynamically linked runtime is available. On Linux, only a statically linked runtime is available.

This section lists shared library requirements for the dynamic version of the runtime on all platforms, and, for Solaris, how to install the static or dynamic runtime according to your preference. It also explains how to recover from problems with the X keysym database that you may have on Solaris if you use the static runtime (which is installed by default on those platforms).

6.5.2 - Irix
